titleStmt.title: Samuel G. Suddarth, Receipt to Isaac W. Scott
CWG13794

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.idno: QMG Box 10; Folder 1865 Transportation, Ordinance (Stores), Arsenal, Postage, Subsistence/Forage, Contingencies; Right Stack

body.p:
No. 22.
The State of Kentucky,
To I. W. Scott Surgeon Genl of Ky Dr.

row.cell: For Expenses incurred in visiting St. Louis Mo: for the relief of a Kentucky Soldier by order of His Excellency T. E. Bramlette Governor of Ky
For contribution to Ky Soldiers in Hospitals at St Louis
For rail road fare to & from St Louis as above --

body.p: Approved and ordered to be paid

I Certify that the above account is correct and just; that the serivces were rendered as stated; and that they were necessary for public service, and will be reported on my return of for the month end-ing the day of 1865.
Captain and Assistant Quarter-Master Ky. Vols.

Received at Frankfort, Kentucky, the 24 of May, 1865, of S. G. SUDDARTH, Quarter-Master General of the State of Kentucky, the sum of Eighty Seven Dollars, and fifty Cents, in full of the above account.

I W Scott
Surg Genl Ky

No. 22.
No. 224 Abstract B"2". Ordnance Qr. 1865.
I. W. Scott, S. G. Ky
Dollars 87 50/100
Paid 24 May, 1865.
Contingences
377
